data.text: @TMusoro @baba_nyenyedzi Gold is smuggled remember Henrietta saga. The state coffers don't get much
@pipchitz @baba_nyenyedzi @TemboMagaso True! They are not being forced to give us Aid. Why do we as a nation want to pride ourselves on western aid - sad particularly when coming from young people.
@baba_nyenyedzi @TemboMagaso Why is the West not taking its AID if Zimbabwe's foreign policy is that bad. Why are they not taking it away???

@TemboMagaso @baba_nyenyedzi Back to square 1… sacrificing principles on the alter of expedience ..how short sighted is that? Where will one draw the line and say enough ?or may be we just have to give up and say to the West , ‘thy will is our command oh gracious master’🙄
@baba_nyenyedzi @TemboMagaso Let me be 'uncritical in thought' but if we are supposed to appease the West in return for 'aid' then we should wallow in poverty for generations to come. Simple
@vegusha03 @TemboMagaso Then you haven’t been following and making your own conclusion devoid of critical thinking. Perhaps you’re correct we truly deserve our poverty.

@baba_nyenyedzi GOZ doesnt give a hoot about that. In another world Zimbabwe has been in its own war for decades, any fuel price increase will add to the poverty until the people break.If the price continues to go up it wont be good for zanupf, its in its best interest to suppress fuel prices

@baba_nyenyedzi @TemboMagaso Been following you and respected your analysis. But if the sum total of your economic analysis is that we need aid...then as a country we well and truly deserve our poverty! Kugarira aid?!🤣🤣🤣

@baba_nyenyedzi I find most of your views on economic policies as tactics and not strategy. It is common cause in economics to take a knock in the short term if the long term or end game objective is worth it. Russia itself is taking a short term knock in the war.
@baba_nyenyedzi The war has a cost to it.
